channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Debris from road traffic collision outside the off licence on Saturday evening, 27th October
item.description:
There is a large amount of vehicle debris on the road and pavement from an RTC which happened on Saturday evening. The debris includes glass from headlights/ rear lights and sharp pieces of plastic from bumpers. It will cause harm to passing vehicle tyres and pedestrians if not removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackfen Road, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Electricity box lid hanging dangerously off, 27th October
item.description:
The metal lid for this electricity box on the side of the road is hanging off the top and knocked me off my bike, as I went past it caught my arm. I went into the Tesco and on my way back looked at it again and tried to fix it but it was live so I left it. I looked at one more time and thought to myself that’s going to kill someone if that isn’t fixed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 230, High Road, West Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned bicycle locked to lamp post on Kyverdale Road, outside number 27, 27th October
item.description:

item.title: Rolled matress in Sycamore Close approach adjacent to child play centre, 27th October
item.description:
Mattress and associated bed have been there for over a week. Bed head ( black vinyl on wood metal frames) and similar sides are nearby. Possible source of vermin for kids play group plus encouragement to further fly tipping by adjacent RBG collection bins.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sycamore Close, Mottingham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Northern tree extremely low hanging, 27th October
item.description:
The horthorne tree outside number 69 broomfield road Beckenham br3 3QB has branches hanging at around 5 feet from pavement height the spikes on the branches are around 3 inches these spikes are capable of taking an eye out or causing lacerations as it did to myself the other week .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broomfield Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
